edu.mills.cs64.final_project

Class Course

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mills.cs64.final_project.Course

  • public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of an academic course. Course information can be loaded from a file through the method loadCourses(String). After this method has been called, courses can be retrieved through the method getCourse(String).
    Version:
    10 April 2016
    Author:
    [replace the brackets and their contents with your Mills id]

      • loadCourses

        public static void loadCourses(java.lang.String filename)
                        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads course information from the specified file, after which the information can be retrieved by calling getCourse(String).

        The file should consist of records in the following format: 

             DEPARTMENT NUMBER
     NAME
     CREDITS
     REQUIREMENTS MET (comma-separated list)
        Here is a sample file: 
             CS 64
     Computer Concepts and Intermediate Programming
     4
     QL
     ARTH 18
     Introduction to Western Art
     3
     CA, CIE, IP
        All courses in the file must meet at least one requirement.

        Results are undefined if the file is not in the proper format. (In other words, there is no error checking and recovery.)

        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file with course information
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found

      • getCourse

        public static Course getCourse(java.lang.String shortName)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets a course that was previously loaded through a call to loadCourses(String).
        Parameters:
        shortName - the short name of the course, as would be returned by getShortName()
        Returns:
        the course, or null if it cannot be found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if courses have not yet been loaded

      • getShortName

        public java.lang.String getShortName()
        Gets a short version of the name of this course. This consists of the department and the number, e.g., "CS 64".
        Returns:
        a short version of the name of this course
